__e: I wasn't sure if I should get her or call the cops or what.
I couldn't take it anymore. He kept talking to her.
But you didn't even call it by it's name, the food. You called it by what it did to your body. I don't get you.
Dear God, after all these years the man I knew as my pa is dead.
I guess he didn't like his first name very much, because... when my husband was a kid,
I mean, after what you'd been through, coming to a new home with a woman that you hardly knew-- and I kept calling you "Ms. Sharp."
I didn't like it much when my mother called me that, and it sure as hell don't sound any sweeter coming from your ass.
I just call her that 'cause She's the closest thing.
She's the only one who called me that, so I knew it was her.
Well, I don't know to this day how his job is called.
What do you call what he was doing before I came in?
The beauty of this is, he has no idea what that last car was called, no idea what he's in now.
Sheriff, do you know what everyone at the Agency used to call your father?
Isn't that what you called your father?
The child they had didn't know... and called her father her uncle... for over 17 years!
